revision.text:
{{short description|2019-2020 concert tour by Madonna}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2019}} {{Infobox concert | concert_tour_name = Madame X Tour | image = Madame X Tour.png | image_size = 220 | landscape = yes | alt = Madonna wearing a black dotted dress, holding a bottle of wine with her arm up, against a wall with a Qashani of "Madame X" logo. | caption = Promotional poster for the tour's London dates | artist = [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] | location = {{Flatlist| * Europe * North America }} | album = ''[[Madame X (album)|Madame X]]'' | start_date = {{Start date|2019|09|17|mf=yes}} | end_date = {{End date|2020|03|08|mf=yes}} | number_of_legs = 2 | number_of_shows = 75 | attendance = | gross = | last_tour = [[Madonna: Tears of a Clown|Tears of a Clown]]
(2016) | this_tour = '''Madame X Tour'''
(2019–2020) | next_tour = }} '''Madame X Tour''' was the eleventh [[concert tour]] by American singer [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], in support of her fourteenth studio album ''[[Madame X (album)|Madame X]]'' (2019). Consisting of 75 dates, the all-[[Theater (structure)|theatre]] tour started on September 17, 2019, in New York City, and concluded on March 8, 2020, in Paris. The tour was managed by [[Maverick (company)|Maverick]] and [[Live Nation Entertainment]]. This marked the first time the singer toured small venues since 1985's [[The Virgin Tour]]. Planned to only include theatres, the tour exclusively consisted of dates in the United States, England, France, and Portugal.{{cite web | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/madonna-madame-x-tour-831602/ | title=Madonna Announces Intimate Theater Performances in 'Madame X' Tour | work=[[Rolling Stone]] | date=May 6, 2019 | access-date=May 6, 2019 | author=Shaffer, Claire }}{{cite web | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8510115/madonna-tour-dates | title=Madonna Announces Intimate 'Madame X' Tour Dates | work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] | date=May 6, 2019 | access-date=May 6, 2019 | author=Kaufman, Gil}}{{cite web | url=https://variety.com/2019/music/news/madonna-reveals-madame-x-tour-dates-1203205856/ | title=Madonna Reveals 'Madame X' Tour Dates | work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] | date=May 6, 2019 | access-date=May 6, 2019}} Due to popular demand, new show dates were added in New York and Los Angeles, the same day the tour was officially announced.{{cite web|url=https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/madonna---madame-x-tour-due-to-overwhelming-demand-additional-shows-just-announced-in-new-york--los-angeles-300844747.html|title=Madonna - Madame X Tour, Due to Overwhelming Demand Additional Shows Just Announced in New York & Los Angeles|work=[[PR Newswire]]|date=May 6, 2019|accessdate=November 26, 2019}} On May 20, 2019, the dates for the remaining US cities were officially announced,{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/madonna-extends-madame-x-tour-dates-837409/|title=Madonna Extends Madame X Theater Tour, Adds Residencies to Four More Cities|author=Kreps, Daniel|work=Rolling Stone|date=May 20, 2019|accessdate=November 26, 2019}} and on September 9, 2019, San Francisco was added to the itinerary.{{Cite web|url=https://www.mercurynews.com/2019/09/09/madonna-brings-theater-tour-to-san-francisco-heres-how-to-get-tickets/|title=Madonna brings theater tour to San Francisco: Here's how to get tickets|author=Harrington, Jim|work=[[The Mercury News]]|date=September 9, 2019|accessdate=November 26, 2019}} The day before the tour officially started, two more shows were added in Miami.{{cite web|url=https://www.miamiherald.com/miami-com/miami-com-news/article235172357.html|title=If you missed the chance to see Madonna's Miami residency, here's your shot|author=Ogle, Connie|work=[[Miami Herald]]|date=September 17, 2019|accessdate=November 26, 2019}} After several cancellations due to a recurring knee injury,{{cite web|url=https://metro.co.uk/2020/02/29/madonna-cries-onstage-falling-off-chair-madame-x-show-paris-amid-knee-injury-12325078/|title=Madonna 'cries onstage after falling off chair during Madame X show' in Paris amid knee injury|author=Karasin, Ekin|work=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|date=February 29, 2020|accessdate=March 9, 2020}} the tour ended abruptly three days before its planned final date, after the [[French government]] announced the ban for gatherings of more than 1,000 people to curb the spread of [[COVID-19]] disease.{{cite web|url=https://www.france24.com/en/20200308-france-bans-gatherings-of-more-than-1-000-people-to-contain-coronavirus|title=France bans gatherings of more than 1,000 people to contain coronavirus|work=[[France 24]]|date=March 8, 2020|accessdate=March 9, 2020}}{{cite web|url=https://www.papelpop.com/2020/03/madame-x-tour-tem-encerramento-antecipado-por-conta-do-coronavirus/|title="Madame X Tour" tem encerramento antecipado por conta do coronavírus|trans-title="Madame X Tour" ends in advance due to coronavirus|language=Portuguese|author=Araujo, Guilherme|work=Papelpop.com|date=March 8, 2020|accessdate=March 9, 2020}} Although an advisement posted on Le Grand Rex's official [[Twitter]] account, on the following day after the ban, claimed that a further official announcement would still be made about the future of whether their next concerts would happen or not,{{cite web|url=https://mobile.twitter.com/LeGrandRex/status/1236939720216756226|title=Suite à l'announce faite hier soir par le ministre de la santé sur l'interdiction des rassemblements de plus de 1000 personnes (...)|trans-title=Following the announcement made last night by the Minister of Health Affairs about the ban of gatherings of more than 1,000 people (...)|language=French|work=Le Grand Rex's official Twitter account|date=March 9, 2020|accessdate=March 9, 2020}} this was done right after, through the singer's official website.{{cite web|url=https://www.madonna.com/news/title/madame-x-tour---10--11-march-shows-are-now-cancelled|title=Madame X Tour - March 10 & 11 shows are now cancelled|work=Madonna Official Website|date=March 9, 2020|accessdate=March 9, 2020}} == Background == Madonna first expressed interest in a smaller-scale show during an interview with [[BBC News]] while promoting the [[Rebel Heart Tour (album)|''Rebel Heart Tour'']] live album in September 2017. She said, "I've done so many shows—world tours, stadiums, sports arenas, you name it—that I feel like I have to reinvent that now too. I like doing intimate shows and being able to talk directly to the audience."{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-41269047|title=Madonna: 'I want to reinvent pop tours'|first=Mark|last=Savage|work=[[BBC News]]|date=September 16, 2017|accessdate=May 10, 2019}} By early May 2019, some media outlets reported that Madonna would announce a tour to support ''[[Madame X (album)|Madame X]]'' album, where she would play 'super small venues' across the United States, along with a few other more details.{{cite web|url=https://pagesix.com/2019/05/05/madonna-to-announce-new-madame-x-tour-on-monday/|title=Madonna to announce new 'Madame X' tour on Monday|author=Mohr, Ian|work=[[New York Post|Pagesix.com]]|date=May 5, 2019|accessdate=November 12, 2019}} Their info was confirmed soon by Madonna herself, who announced it through a comedy video, posted on her social networks, where she was having a hangout with longtime collaborator [[Diplo]].{{cite web|url=https://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/app/noticia/diversao-e-arte/2019/05/06/interna_diversao_arte,753423/madonna-datas-da-turne-do-novo-disco.shtml|title=Madonna anuncia primeiras datas oficiais da turnê 'Madame X Tour'|trans-title=Madonna announces first official dates of 'Madame X Tour'|language=Portuguese|author=Moura, Izabella|work=[[Correio Braziliense]]|date=May 6, 2019|accessdate=November 12, 2019}} A few days prior to opening night, it was reported she would implement a no-phone policy in order to maximise the intimacy of the show and for people to concentrate on the art itself.{{cite web|url=https://www.dailystar.co.uk/music/madonna-madame-x-tour-phones-19909670|title=Madonna bans all phones and cameras from her Madame X world tour|author=Hardwick, Jack|work=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|The Daily Star]]|date=September 8, 2019|accessdate=September 9, 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.fr/entry/madonna-interdit-a-son-tour-les-portables-a-ses-concerts_fr_5d74f32de4b07521022e0e3b/|title=Madonna interdit à son tour les portables à ses concerts|trans-title=Madonna bans phones at her tour concerts|language=French|work=[[HuffPost|HuffPost France]]|date=September 8, 2019|accessdate=September 8, 2019}} For this policy, Madonna partnered with [[Yondr]], which is a phone-sealing bag company.{{cite web|url=https://www.papermag.com/madonna-madame-x-tour-2640455216.html|title=Madonna X-periments With the 'Madame X Tour'|author=Stern, Bradley|work=[[Paper (magazine)|Papermag.com]]|date=September 20, 2019|accessdate=November 12, 2019}} However, this has received mixed reactions from fans online.{{cite web|url=https://thatgrapejuice.net/2019/09/madonna-slammed-own-fans-for-banning-cell-phones-from-madame-tour/|title=Madonna slammed by own fans for banning cell phones from 'Madame X' Tour|author=Rashad|work=ThatGrapeJuice.net|date=September 8, 2019|accessdate=September 9, 2019}} This no-phone policy has been kept for both Lisbon{{cite web|url=https://www.dn.pt/cultura/madonna-sem-jornalistas-nem-telemoveis-11697681.html|title=Madonna sem jornalistas nem telemóveis|trans-title=Madonna with no journalists nor cellphones|language=Portuguese|work=[[Diário de Notícias]]|date=January 12, 2020|accessdate=January 12, 2020}} and London{{cite web|url=https://lwtheatres.co.uk/whats-on/madonna/|title=Madonna - Madame X|work=[[Really Useful Group#LW Theaters|LW Theaters]]|date=January 23, 2020|accessdate=January 23, 2020}} batches of gigs. Madonna made the following statement regarding the people who violated the no-camera policy: "Three shows into ''Madame X'' and I've enjoyed every minute of this intimate experience! I love looking into the audience and not seeing [[iPhone]]'s and cameras flashing but instead eyes, smiles and happy human faces. However I am mystified and confused by some people who insist on sneaking in second cameras and disregarding my request to not record the show. This request is common at all [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] shows, [[concert|dance concerts]], [[stand up comedy]] and the [[opera]]. People who ignore my request are not allowing themselves to enjoy the show completely but also show a lack of respect and consideration for my wishes. If you can't live without your phone for two hours this experience is not for you."{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/B2mlobsBDhi/|title=3 shows into Madame X (...)|work=Madonna's Official [[Instagram]]|accessdate=September 20, 2019}} In relation to merchandise, Madonna announced a [[Pop-up retail|pop-up shop]] a week before the first show in [[New York City]].{{cite web|url=https://www.iconvsicon.com/2019/09/12/madonnas-madame-x-tour-kickoff-to-feature-exclusive-pop-up-shop-in-nyc/|title=Madonna's Madame X Tour Kickoff to Feature Exclusive Pop-up Shop in NYC!|author=Price, Jason|work=Icon vs. Icon|date=September 12, 2019|accessdate=September 16, 2019}} Additionally, she collaborated with Too Faced cosmetics to release two make-up kits that are inspired by the make-up Madonna will be using during the shows.{{cite web|url=https://www.elle.com/uk/beauty/make-up/a29033155/madonna-too-faced-makeup-collection/|title=Everything You Need To Know About Madonna's Make-Up Collection With Too Faced|author=Bitmead, Charlotte|work=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle.com]]|date=September 13, 2019|accessdate=September 16, 2019}} A similar pop-up store has been open in Paris from March 4 to 14, 2020, during French batch of concerts.{{cite web|url=https://www.sortiraparis.com/interests/shopping-fashion/articles/210402-madonna-madame-x-mae-couture-the-pop-up-store-in-paris/lang/en|title=Madonna: Madame X Mae Couture, the pop-up store in Paris|author=Laura B.|work=sortiraparis.com|date=March 5, 2020|accessdate=March 8, 2020}} == Development == Madonna begun the tour rehearsals around late May 2019, by doing various workshops, where, among other stuff, the dancers, setlist and arrangements were chosen. By then, she documented her daily work through her [[Instagram]] social account, namely rehearsals. {{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/Bx5M4b0h_lq/?hl=en-us|title=Life is a dark ballet. (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=May 25, 2019|accessdate=October 13, 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/ByGQWUWhvrV/?hl=en-us|title=Madame X is putting on her gloves (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=May 30, 2019|accessdate=October 13, 2019}} After her performance at [[Stonewall 50 - WorldPride NYC 2019]], the workshops also ended, and rehearsals went ahead with full choices made. This time, all daily work was being documented not only by Madonna herself, but also by her tour crew.{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/Bzq3nqShE0v/?hl=en-us|title=Madame X is back to work (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=July 7, 2019|accessdate=October 13, 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BztDlQuhE63/?hl=en-us|title=Lisbon has arrived in Brooklyn (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=July 9, 2019|accessdate=October 13, 2019}} Among the numerous videos and pictures that the singer posted, one of these included Madonna, joined by the Orquestra Batukadeiras, rehearsing her 1991 single, "[[Rescue Me (Madonna song)|Rescue Me]]", which had never been performed on a tour. {{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/amp/articles/news/8521139/madonna-teases-tour-rehearsal-video-rescue-me|title=Madonna Teases Tour Rehearsal Video for 'Rescue Me', Which She's Never Performed Live|author=Caulfield, Keith|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=July 18, 2019|accessdate=October 13, 2019}} This performance ended up being replaced for a video interlude instead. "Looking for Mercy" and "[[Rain (Madonna song)|Rain]]" were also rehearsed but didn't make the final cut.{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/B2YRsGWh-N7/?hl=en-us|title=You Never know when its going to rain (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=September 14, 2019|accessdate=October 21, 2019}} Additional songs chronicled by her Instagram account that were rehearsed, but ultimately axed, included "[[You Must Love Me]]",{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/Bz_xpZdgIfE/?hl=en-us|title=Madame X (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=July 16, 2019|accessdate=October 14, 2019}} "[[What It Feels Like for a Girl]]",{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/Bz8hd8KBA_n/?hl=en-us|title=What it feels like for a Girl? (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=July 15, 2019|accessdate=October 14, 2019}} and "Easy Ride".{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/B0KC4-8BWFh/?hl=en-us|title=Estere rehearsing Easy Ride (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=July 20, 2019|accessdate=October 14, 2019}} "Falling Free" from ''[[MDNA (album)|MDNA]]'' was rehearsed as a dance interlude but has not yet been performed.{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/B2CnTqeBQH1/?hl=en-us|title=Falling Free-Style (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=September 5, 2019|accessdate=October 21, 2019}} Around late August, Madonna and her crew moved tour rehearsals to the BAM Howard Gilman Opera House, to complete the rehearsal process before the tour kicked off.{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/B1rWptChj85/?hl=en-us|title=Madame X. Reporting to Duty (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=August 27, 2019|accessdate=October 13, 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/B1uLjnABEV_/?hl=en-us|title=Current mood (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=August 28, 2019|accessdate=October 13, 2019}} == Critical reception == [[File:Madame x - London Palladium.jpg|thumb|Madonna at London Palladium in 2020.]] The first three nights of the show at the [[Brooklyn Academy of Music]] were met with universal acclaim from critics. Leah Greenblatt from ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' stated, "[...] when the construct of Madame X disappeared, what remained was something simpler and somehow much more satisfying than the equestrian or the cha-cha instructor or the saint (or even the mother, the magpie, the erstwhile standup comedian): Not just a pop star and perennial provocateur, but an artist in full."{{cite web|url=https://ew.com/concerts/2019/09/20/madonna-madame-x-tour-review-brooklyn/|title=Madonna brings freewheeling intimacy to Madame X Tour|author=Greenblatt, Leah|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=September 20, 2019|accessdate=September 21, 2019}} Jon Pareles from ''[[The New York Times]]'' wrote: "As both album and show, "Madame X" is Madonna's latest declaration of a defiant, self-assured, flexible identity that's entirely comfortable with dualities [...] Yes, she is 61, but her music remains determinedly contemporary."{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/18/arts/music/madame-x-madonna.html|title=Madonna Is Still Taking Chances|author=Pareles, Jon|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=September 18, 2019|accessdate=September 21, 2019}} Rob Sheffield from ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' stated, "Madonna has never shied away from taking chances. Thirty years after she set fire to [[1980s in music|the Eighties]] with the disco basilica Like a Prayer, she's as gloriously weird as ever. Hence her excellent new Madame X tour, a testament to the genius in her madness. [...] (Mentioning [[Bruce Springsteen]]) How gratifying that these two Eighties icons are not only still topping the charts, they're doing it with their wildest, most experimental work. We chose well when we picked these two as our heroes, right? As Madame X proves, Madonna will never be the kind of superstar who repeats her successes, sticks to her strengths, or plays it safe. Instead, she's getting weirder with age. Thank all the angels and saints for that."{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-live-reviews/madonna-madame-x-tour-sheffield-887601/|title=Why Madonna's Madame X Tour Is the Gloriously Insane Mess of Your Dreams|author=Sheffield, Rob|work=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=September 20, 2019|accessdate=September 21, 2019}} Amy Linden from ''[[Pollstar]]'' wrote, "[...] But perhaps her most significant cultural impact is that while she might not always be the first one in the pool, over the course of close to four decades she's proven herself to be the performer who makes the biggest splash and whose artistic choices continue to matter."{{cite web|url=https://www.pollstar.com/article/madonnas-madame-x-show-takes-the-underplay-to-the-next-level-live-review-141127|title=Madonna's Madame X Tour Takes The Underplay To The Next Level: Live Review|author=Linden, Amy|work=[[Pollstar]]|date=September 24, 2019|accessdate=September 27, 2019}} Despite positive reception, Madonna has faced frequent criticism over the lateness of each show, often starting on average two hours later than announced.{{cite web|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/music/ct-ent-madonna-madame-x-concerts-chicago-theater-1015-20191015-wvplby2rufh53fkjy4dbxvcog4-story.html|title=Madonna is in Chicago this week - with a show that doesn't start until 10:30 and runs more than two hours. Fans aren't happy.|author=Williams, Kevin|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=October 15, 2019|accessdate=November 11, 2019}} Ticket distributors did eventually send emails out announcing a later start time in an attempt to minimize the backlash.{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/madonna-madame-x-tour-fan-lawsuit-stage-time-delay-late-a9198141.html|title=Madonna sued by fan for starting concert two hours later than scheduled|author=White, Adam|work=[[The Independent]]|date=November 11, 2019|accessdate=November 11, 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/madonna-frequently-hours-late-concerts-fan-says-he-s-suing-n1079301|title=Madonna is frequently hours late for concerts, a fan says. He's suing.|author=Burke, Minnyvonne|work=[[NBC News]]|date=November 9, 2019|accessdate=November 11, 2019}} In her Las Vegas show, she clarified to the booing crowd that 'A queen is never late' and that she did not appreciate the hostility, heckling, and demand for refunds. One concertgoer announced that they were filing a lawsuit over the late start time of the show. At the end of the year, [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] added the Madame X Tour on its list of the best live shows of 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/concerts/8545263/best-concerts-2019-live-shows|title=The Best Live Shows Of 2019: Staff Picks|work=Billboard|date=December 4, 2019|accessdate=January 2, 2020}} == Recording == Back at the beginning of 2019, the Lisbon-based production service company Krypton International worked on the mini-documentary ''The World of Madame X'', filmed by Madonna longtime contributor Nuno Xico,{{cite web|url=https://lbbonline.com/news/madonna-welcomes-you-to-the-world-of-madame-x-in-new-promo/|title=Madonna Welcomes You to 'The World of Madame X' in New Promo|work=LBBOnline.com|date=November 4, 2019|accessdate=January 13, 2020}} that ended up being released in early July 2019 by [[Amazon Prime]].{{cite web|url=https://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/music-news/madonna-releases-world-of-madame-x-documentary-on-amazon-prime-video/|title=Madonna releases World of Madame X documentary on Amazon Prime Video|author=Ellwood-Hughes, Pip|work=Entertainment-focus.com|date=July 5, 2019|accessdate=January 16, 2020}} On January 12, 2020, this company posted, via their official [[Instagram]] account, a picture of an 'All Stage Access Pass' for the Lisbon tour evening happening that day, followed by the information that they were shooting and recording that concert for a potential subsequent live album and Blu-Ray.{{cite web|url=https://blitz.pt/principal/update/2020-01-13-Primeiro-concerto-de-Madonna-no-Coliseu-de-Lisboa-foi-filmado|title=Primeiro concerto de Madonna no Coliseu de Lisboa foi filmado|trans-title =The first Madonna concert at the Lisbon Colisseum was shot|language=Portuguese|author=Pereira, Lia|work=[[Blitz (magazine)|Blitz.pt]]|date=January 13, 2020|accessdate=January 13, 2020}} == Set list == The following set list was obtained from the concert held on September 17, 2019, in New York City.{{cite web|url=https://www.mylondon.news/whats-on/music-nightlife-news/madonna-madame-x-tour-setlist-16938613|title=Here's the Madonna setlist for her Madame X Tour|author=Yates, Jonathan|work=MyLondon|date=September 18, 2019|access-date=September 18, 2019|publisher=[[Reach plc]]|archive-url=http://archive.is/Z0BTb |archive-date=October 31, 2019}} It does not represent all concerts for the duration of the tour. {{div col}} # "[[God Control]]" # "[[Dark Ballet]]" # "[[Human Nature (Madonna song)|Human Nature]]" {{small|(contains elements of "Express Yourself")}} # "[[Express Yourself (Madonna song)|Express Yourself]]" # "Madame X Manifesto" {{small|(video interlude)}} # "[[Vogue (Madonna song)|Vogue]]" # "[[I Don't Search I Find]]" # "[[Papa Don't Preach]]" # "[[American Life (song)|American Life]]" # "The Coffin" {{small|(video interlude)}} # "[[Batuka (song)|Batuka]]" # "Fado Pechincha" {{small|(performed with Gaspar Varela)}} # "Killers Who Are Partying" # "Crazy" # "[[La Isla Bonita]]" {{small|(contains elements from "Welcome to My Fado Club")}} # "[[Sodade]]" # "[[Medellín (song)|Medellín]]" # "Extreme Occident" # "[[Rescue Me (Madonna song)|Rescue Me]]" {{small|(interlude)}} # "[[Frozen (Madonna song)|Frozen]]" # "Come Alive" # "[[Future (Madonna and Quavo song)|Future]]" # "[[Crave (song)|Crave]]" {{small|([[Tracy Young]] Remix)}} # "[[Like a Prayer (song)|Like a Prayer]]" '''Encore''': #
  • "[[I Rise (song)|I Rise]]" {{div col end}} '''Notes''' *From November 17 to December 21, 2019, "Sodade" was temporarily removed from the set list.{{cite web|url=https://www.sun-sentinel.com/entertainment/music/fl-et-madonna-madame-x-tour-fillmore-miami-beach-20191210-ikne2dfjkzep5pd6wttu6dm45q-story.html|title=Eight things to know before you go to Madonna's Madame X Tour residency at Fillmore Miami Beach|author=Crandell, Ben|work=[[Sun-Sentinel]]|date=December 13, 2019|accessdate=December 16, 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.abc.es/estilo/gente/abci-madonna-prohibe-telefonos-moviles-durante-conciertos-lisboa-202001131247_noticia.html|title=Madonna prohíbe los teléfonos móviles durante sus conciertos en Lisboa|trans-title=Madonna forbids cellphones during her concerts in Lisbon|language=Spanish|author=Chacón, Francisco|work=[[ABC (newspaper)|ABC.es]]|date=January 13, 2020|accessdate=January 13, 2020}} *On November 25, 2019, Swae Lee joined the performance of "Crave".{{cite web|url=https://exitoina.uol.com.br/noticias/musica/madonna-e-swae-lee-cantam-crave-juntos-pela-primeira-vez-na-madame-x-tour-assista.phtml|title=Madonna e Swae Lee cantam Crave juntos pela primeira vez na Madame X Tour; assista|trans-title=Madonna and Swae Lee sing Crave together for the first time at the Madame X Tour: watch|language=Portuguese|work=[[Universo Online|Exitoína]]|date=November 28, 2019|accessdate=March 14, 2020}} Additionally, Madonna performed an [[a capella]] version of "[[Fever (Little Willie John song)#Madonna version|Fever]]."{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/B5nuf3jBkhX/?hl=en-us|title=My Fever Finally Broke (...)|work=Madonna's Official Instagram|date=December 3, 2019|accessdate=December 13, 2019}} *Starting on January 12, 2020, "Papa Don't Preach" was removed from the set list and "Sodade" was performed as a duet with Portuguese singer Dino d'Santiago.{{cite web|url=https://blitz.pt/principal/update/2020-01-16-Madonna-Lisboa-tens-sido-tao-boa-para-mim|title=Madonna: "Lisboa, tens sido tão boa para mim"|trans-title=Madonna: "Lisboa you have been so Good to Me"|language=Portuguese|work=[[Blitz (magazine)|Blitz.pt]]|date=January 16, 2020|accessdate=January 19, 2020}} *On January 12 and 14, 2020, Madonna performed [[Elvis Presley]]'s "[[Can't Help Falling in Love]]" a capella. *On February 5 and 13, 2020, Madonna performed "[[Don't Cry for Me Argentina#Madonna version|Don't Cry For Me Argentina]]", as a tribute to the song composer, [[Andrew Lloyd Webber]], who was allegedly present at the concert of that night.{{cite web|url=https://www.castanet.net/news/Entertainment/276542/Madonna-defies-curtain|title=Madonna defies curtain|work=[[Castanet (disambiguation)#Other|Castanet.net]]|date=February 7, 2020|accessdate=February 11, 2020}} *On February 6, 2020, Madonna performed [[Simon and Garfunkel]]'s "[[The Sound of Silence]]."{{cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/madonna-praises-eminem-on-gun-control-with-the-sound-of-silence-cover-2606519|title=Madonna praises Eminem on gun control with 'The Sound of Silence' cover|author=Neale, Matthew|work=[[NME]]|date=February 8, 2020|accessdate=February 9, 2020}} *During some European concerts, "Crave" was dropped from the setlist.{{cite web|url=https://www.parismatch.com/Culture/Spectacles/Hier-soir-a-Paris-Madonna-1675108|title=Hier soir à Paris... Madonna|trans-title=Last night in Paris... Madonna|language=French|author=Leclerc, Fabrice|work=[[Paris Match]]|date=February 23, 2020|accessdate=February 28, 2020}} *During some Paris concerts, Madonna performed [[Edith Piaf]]'s signature song "[[La vie en rose]]."{{cite web|url=https://www.nouvelobs.com/musique/20200227.OBS25363/madonna-au-grand-rex-un-show-entre-cabaret-burlesque-et-stand-up-engage.html|title=Madonna au Grand Rex: un
